Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek (South Ionian) pottery plate; gritty clay with much silver mica; fugitive white slip, brownish fired glaze; exterior: traces of three or more bands; outside of rim glazed; on top of rim, between lines zig-zag line with dotes in interstices; broad band on outside of floor, lotus flower and bud frieze to the centre.
Curator's comments: Compare Ashkelon 3, 239, no. 270, from post-604 BC fill, though the rim decoration appears there, 236, no.262, from a pre-604 fill.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.911)
